intro: Lucinaea neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia lucinaea, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
